result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob J. Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob J. Larson was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Jacob J. Larson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob J. Larson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: State's Exhibit 1 - DVD - Retained in Exhibit Drawer

10:33 a.m. Defendant Jacob J. Larson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf262 and 15cm437. State moves to dismiss Count 1 in 15cm437 - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3, 4 and 6 in 15cf262 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig - compliance with Victim rights legislation in both cases. State's Exhibit 1 (DVD) marked - Off record 10:44 a.m. for Court review of DVD. On record 10:52 a.m. 
Michlig/Hogan/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
In 15cf262 - Count 2
Jail - 6 months with Huber for all purposes to commence within 20 days.
Jail credit - 47 days
Costs - 

In 15cf262 - Count 5 and 15cm437 - Count 2
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Sample/Superivision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Anger management counseling
No contact with Joleen Ripley
No intoxicants; no taverns
AODA assessment and follow-through 
Restitution of out-of-pocket expenses of victim to be determined within 30 days


Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. 
Adj. 11:20 a.m.
No intoxicants; no taverns; no contact with Ripley
Cash bond $500; Surety bond $2,000 to be signed by mother

2:11 p.m. Defendant Jacob J. Larson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Jacob J. Larson in custody.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf262, 15cm437. State files Amended Information in 15cf262. Hogan in receipt of Amended Information - enters not guilty plea to Count 4. Hogan speaks to Motion to modify bond. Michlig statement to motion. Court statement to motion - Court modifies bond - $500 cash bond - no contact with Ripley - no intoxicants; no taverns. Court converts to $2000 surety bond and Mother must co-sign and $500 cash bond. Trial date to remain - counsel to advise if resolution is reached. Adj. 2:25 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

1:19 p.m. Defendant Jacob J. Larson in court, via video, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Jacob J. Larson in custody.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan waives reading - enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Hogan states December 2, 2015 date obtained earlier from Branch 1 for plea/sentencing should remain for bail modification hearing - Hogan requests trial dates - Adj. 1:23 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

3:33 p.m. Defendant Jacob J. Larson in court, via video, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan states does not know why defendant is appearing by video --requests adjournment for arraignment and possible resolution. Court states that video arraignment is allowed by statute.  Michlig is not as hopeful for resolution tomorrow - states there are issues with victim rights - Court states defendant will appear by video.  Arraignment scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jacob J. Larson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Jacob J. Larson in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:36
State calls Officer  Elisha Williams/sworn/direct - witness IDs defendant- shows state's exhibit 1 (statement of victim) offered/received /Cross by Hogan 
Court finds probable cause exists and binds over - 
Bail continued
  Arraignment scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

2:34 p.m. Defendant Jacob J. Larson in court via video  with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Jacob J. Larson in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - Hogan motion to modify bond/Michlig statement to bond - Court denies motion to modify -set for preliminary hearing.
Bail continued. Adj. 2:41 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Judge O'Melia has underlying cases.  Transfer by court rule.
No contact WHATSOEVER with Joleen Ripley. No intoxicants; no taverns.

1:19 p.m. Defendant Jacob J. Larson in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD's office as Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan represents in underlying matter,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $2500 cash bond. Intra Circuit transfer to Branch 1. Defendant advised to contact PD's office today. Adj. 1:24 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
